item.1.text: Kept it to a few kisses,
My fingers just beginning to touch
The thick curls of her hair—
item.2.text: And one of the bricks careens

item.1.text: The liquid drawn close to my lips
item.2.text: Into a creek and cracks off the skull

item.0.text: The way the shops closing early
item.2.text: Of a snapper too slow to see

item.1.text: At the bottom of the glass.

item.2.text: A brick without his name on it,
With no need for his meat.
And so we wind up hunting

item.1.text: For the smallness of the sip,

item.0.text: While the men share joking jabs
item.1.text: What a full swallow would mask,
item.2.text: But buying and mincing garlic anyway,
And the trees where they gather

item.0.text: Which collect like dead birds overnight.
